title: [491. Non-decreasing Subsequences](https://leetcode.cn/problems/non-decreasing-subsequences/)
content:
| English | 简体中文 |
491. Non-decreasing Subsequences Description Given an integer array nums, return all the different possible non-decreasing subsequences of the given array with at least two elements. You may return the answer in any order.
 
Example 1:
Input: nums = [4,6,7,7] Output: [[4,6],[4,6,7],[4,6,7,7],[4,7],[4,7,7],[6,7],[6,7,7],[7,7]] Example 2:
Input: nums = [4,4,3,2,1] Output: [[4,4]]  
Constraints:
1 <= nums.length <= 15 -100 <= nums[i] <= 100 Related Topics Bit Manipulation Array Hash Table Backtracking Similar Questions Maximum Length of Pair Chain
